page.title: 04A DAY AT BLACKO SCHOOL (1)
page.content: Tracey stepped through the door of Blacko School just as the bell rang. She was later than she wanted to be because she wanted to finish off a poster she was colouring. Mr. Wright, the school's headmaster came through to call everyone into assembly. Alexandra took her place on the piano stool and Kathryn sat on a chair beside her. Since Mrs. Leese had retired these two girls had been playing the piano and flute in assembly. Mr. Wright talked about the usual things. He picked up an egg and teased the infants, pretending it could speak. Then all the children sang 'Morning has broken'. "Hands together, eyes closed," commanded Mr. Wright, so everyone got ready to say their prayers. Assembly finished and the children went back to their classrooms to begin a day's work.
